summary: A 2009 law created a tax disparity among different types of tobacco products, with cigarettes, roll-your-own tobacco, and small cigars taxed at one rate and pipe tobacco and some large cigars taxed at lower rates. In a 2012 report , we found that tax revenue decreased after the law because manufacturers made and consumers bought more of the lower-taxed products. We previously recommended that Congress...
title: Tobacco Taxes: Market Shifts toward Lower-Taxed Products Continue to Reduce Federal Revenue
